tweet: Today I voted to reject the President’s ban on transgender troops in the military. The brave men and women who serve our country to protect our freedoms should never be subjected to such bigotry. #ProtectTransTroops #TransVisibilityWeek

“The equivalent of a nuclear bomb fell on our country when the president said what he said this week,” Representative Anna G. Eshoo said Wednesday as her House subcommittee began pushing through health care legislation. “This is deadly serious.” https://nyti.ms/2TYqeaW

On average, a woman makes only 80 cents for every dollar earned by her white male counterpart. Help is on the way! The House passed the #PaycheckFairnessAct today, requiring companies to prove that pay disparities exist for legitimate reasons not based on gender alone.

A third of uninsured Americans aren’t taking their medicine as prescribed because prices are unaffordable. Unacceptable! My Health Subcommittee considered seven bills last week on drug pricing and we will produce legislation to bring down drug prices. https://tinyurl.com/y4jn4flr

March is #WomensHistoryMonth! 2019 has brought 131 women to serve in Congress—the largest number in U.S. history, and we stand on the shoulders of women who fought for equality and access to opportunity. Jeannette Rankin was one such woman, the first elected to the House in 1916 pic.twitter.com/oWOlrxn2ea

On behalf of the people of California’s 18th Congressional District, we join the world community in mourning New Zealand’s loss of lives. We reaffirm our condemnation of all forms of hatred and intolerance, and we carry the families of the victims in our hearts and in our prayers

It’s hard to believe that 29 states allow housing and employment discrimination based on sexual orientation & 30 states lack non-discrimination laws for gender identity. I'm cosponsoring the #EqualityAct to protect the civil rights of LGBT people across every state in our country

My House Committee held a hearing today to discuss the Save the Internet Act. I’m cosponsoring this 3-page, common-sense bill to restore #NetNeutrality and #SaveTheNet. To keep the Internet free and open, we must pass this bill.
